Ayurveda.name: Chyawanprash
Ayurveda.overview: Chyawanprash is an Ayurvedic Rasayana (rejuvenator and longevity-promoting formulation) whose Sanskrit meaning is 'The rejuvenating elixir created for Sage Chyavana.' It contains 40-50 herbs with key ingredients like Amla, Ghee, Honey, Pippali, Ashwagandha, Shatavari, and Guduchi.
preparation: Amla Decoction: Boil and mash fresh Amla to extract pulp.
Herbal Decoction: Boil 40 herbs to form a concentrated extract.
Mixing with Sugar & Ghee: Cook Amla pulp with sugar syrup, add ghee, sesame oil, and honey.
Adding Spices: Incorporate cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and other herbs.
Store in airtight jars for up to 3 years.
uses: Boosts immunity and prevents common illnesses.
Enhances memory, concentration, and brain health.
Supports respiratory system and relieves cough or asthma.
Promotes vitality, stamina, and glowing skin.
Aids sleep quality and reduces stress.

how_to_take.adults: 1–2 teaspoons with warm milk or water, morning & night.
how_to_take.timing: Best taken on an empty stomach or before sleep.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Represents balance between Rasa (taste), Ojas (vitality), and Medha (intellect). Nourishes every tissue and promotes inner vitality.

Ayurveda.name: Giloy
Ayurveda.overview: Giloy (Tinospora cordifolia), known as 'nectar of immortality,' balances all three doshas and enhances immunity.
Ayurveda.properties: Bitter and astringent taste, light and unctuous qualities, warm potency, sweet post-digestive effect.
uses: Controls blood sugar and reduces stress.

how_to_take.Juice: Take 15–30 ml Giloy juice with water daily.
how_to_take.Powder: ½ teaspoon powder with warm water twice a day.
how_to_take.Capsules: Take 1 capsule twice daily after meals.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Symbolizes 'fire of transformation,' strengthening Prana (life energy) and resilience.

Ayurveda.name: Amla
Ayurveda.overview: Amla (Indian Gooseberry) is the 'Divine Fruit of Immortality,' rich in Vitamin C and rejuvenating for all doshas.
Ayurveda.properties: Sour, sweet, bitter, pungent, and astringent taste; light, dry qualities; cooling potency; sweet post-digestive effect.
uses: Improves digestion, hair, and eye health.
Supports liver, heart, and respiratory system.

how_to_take.Juice: Consume 10–20 ml Amla juice with water every morning.
how_to_take.Powder: ½ teaspoon Amla powder with honey after meals.
how_to_take.Murabba: Eat 1 Amla murabba daily as a sweet tonic.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: A cooling Rasayana symbolizing balance and rejuvenation — being 'beyond attachment and aversion.'

Ayurveda.name: Triphala
Ayurveda.overview: Triphala is a Tridoshic Rasayana composed of Amla, Haritaki, and Bibhitaki, promoting balance and detoxification.
preparation: Dry and powder each fruit individually.
Mix equal proportions to form Triphala Churna.

how_to_take.Powder: ½–1 teaspoon with warm water at night.
how_to_take.Tea: Boil 1 teaspoon in water for 5 minutes.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Balances cleansing and nourishment; promotes Ojas (vital energy) and harmony.

Ayurveda.name: Haldi
Ayurveda.overview: Haldi (Turmeric) means 'the one that enhances inner radiance.' Known for anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and purifying effects.
Ayurveda.properties: Bitter and pungent taste; light, dry; hot potency; balances Kapha and Vata.
Ayurveda.preparation: Harvest, boil, dry, grind, and store rhizomes.
uses: Enhances skin glow and wound healing.
Used in spiritual rituals for purity.
Ayurveda.how_to_take: Mix in warm milk or use in cooking; apply as face pack.

Ayurveda.name: Neem
Ayurveda.overview: Neem means 'the bestower of health and longevity.' It is a strong detoxifying and purifying herb.
Ayurveda.properties: Bitter, astringent taste; light, dry; cold potency; balances Pitta and Kapha.
Ayurveda.preparation: Collect leaves, bark, flowers; dry, crush, extract juice or oil.
uses: Treats acne, eczema, and skin infections.
Acts as a natural insect repellent.
Ayurveda.how_to_take: Consume powder with honey or warm water; use leaf paste or diluted oil externally.

Ayurveda.name: Brahmi
Ayurveda.overview: Brahmi (Bacopa monnieri) is known as 'that which gives knowledge' and is revered for enhancing intellect and memory.
Ayurveda.properties: Bitter taste; light, oily qualities; cooling potency; sweet post-digestive effect; balances Pitta and Kapha.
uses: Promotes restful sleep and emotional stability.
Enhances hair growth and skin rejuvenation.

how_to_take.Juice: Take 1–2 teaspoons of Brahmi juice in the morning on an empty stomach.
how_to_take.Powder: ¼–½ teaspoon Brahmi powder with warm milk before sleep.
how_to_take.Oil: Massage scalp with Brahmi oil twice a week for mental calmness.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Symbol of awareness and consciousness — nourishes both intellect and calmness.

Ayurveda.name: Ashwagandha
Ayurveda.overview: Ashwagandha (Withania somnifera) means 'that which has the strength of a horse.' It promotes vitality and longevity.
Ayurveda.properties: Bitter, astringent, sweet taste; light, oily qualities; warm potency; balances Vata and Kapha.
uses: Enhances energy, muscle strength, and sleep.

how_to_take.Powder: ½–1 teaspoon with warm milk or ghee before bedtime.
how_to_take.Tea: Boil 1 teaspoon powder in water for 5 minutes; drink warm.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: A rejuvenating Rasayana that restores strength and balances body-mind harmony.

Ayurveda.name: Shankhpushpi
Ayurveda.overview: Shankhpushpi (Convolvulus pluricaulis) is a Medhya Rasayana promoting intellect, calmness, and memory.
Ayurveda.properties: Bitter and sweet taste; light, unctuous; cool potency; balances Vata and Pitta.
uses: Improves focus, learning, and mental clarity.
Reduces anxiety and promotes natural sleep.

how_to_take.Syrup: Take 1–2 teaspoons of Shankhpushpi syrup daily.
how_to_take.Powder: ½ teaspoon powder with warm milk before bed.
how_to_take.Ghrita: 1 teaspoon with warm water or milk for calmness.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Symbolizes mental peace and clarity, harmonizing mind and spirit.

Ayurveda.name: Jatamansi
Ayurveda.overview: Jatamansi (Spikenard) is a Medhya Rasayana that supports mental peace, emotional balance, and nervous health.
Ayurveda.properties: Bitter, astringent, sweet taste; light, oily; cool potency; balances Pitta and Kapha.
Ayurveda.preparation: Dry roots in shade, grind into powder, and prepare oil or decoction.
uses: Improves sleep, reduces anxiety, and enhances cognition.
Ayurveda.how_to_take: Consume powder with warm milk or honey; use oil for massage.
Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Symbol of Sattva — promoting emotional stability, deep rest, and spiritual clarity.

Ayurveda.name: Tulsi
Ayurveda.overview: Tulsi (Holy Basil), the 'Queen of Herbs,' promotes purity, immunity, and spiritual balance.
Ayurveda.properties: Pungent and bitter taste; light, dry; hot potency; balances Kapha and Vata.
Ayurveda.preparation: Collect, shade-dry leaves; use as fresh juice, tea, powder, or oil.
Ayurveda.how_to_take: Chew fresh leaves, drink as tea, or consume juice with honey.
Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Represents purity and harmony, bringing emotional clarity and vitality.

Ayurveda.name: Ghee
Ayurveda.overview: Ghee (Clarified Butter) is the purest form of Ayurvedic fat, symbolizing nourishment and clarity.
Ayurveda.properties: Sweet taste; heavy, unctuous, soft qualities; cooling potency; sweet post-digestive effect; balances Vata and Pitta.
Ayurveda.preparation: Boil milk, form curd, churn butter, clarify it by heating, then filter and store.
uses: Improves brain, skin, and hair health.
Ayurveda.how_to_take: Consume daily with warm milk or meals; use as a base for herbal formulations or external oil.
Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Symbol of nourishment, love, and consciousness — feeds both body and soul.

Ayurveda.name: Bel Patra
Ayurveda.overview: Bel Patra (Bael Leaf) is sacred to Lord Shiva and symbolizes purification and harmony.
Ayurveda.properties: Astringent, bitter, sweet taste; light, dry qualities; heating potency; balances Kapha and Vata.
Ayurveda.preparation: Collect, wash, and shade-dry leaves. Prepare as juice, powder, or decoction.
uses: Purifies blood and supports heart health.

how_to_take.Powder: ½ teaspoon after meals with water.

Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Balances Tridosha and embodies purity, enhancing clarity and spiritual harmony.

Ayurveda.name: Herbal Teas
Ayurveda.overview: Herbal Tea (Kwath) is an Ayurvedic infusion of herbs, flowers, roots, and spices that balance body, mind, and spirit.
Ayurveda.properties: Light, aromatic, soothing; customizable for Vata, Pitta, and Kapha.
Ayurveda.preparation: Boil 1–2 cups water, add 1–2 tsp herbs, simmer 5–10 minutes, strain, and serve warm with honey or lemon.

common_varieties.Ginger Tea: Improves digestion and warms the body.
common_varieties.Chamomile Tea: Calms the mind and promotes sleep.

benefits: Relieves stress and detoxifies the body.
Ayurveda.how_to_take: Drink 1–2 cups daily, morning and evening; always warm, sweeten with honey or jaggery.
Ayurveda.ayurvedic_insight: Each cup awakens Prana — harmonizing inner rhythm with nature.
